content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

```julia
function extract_julia_code(md::String)
    julia_blocks = filter(s -> startswith(s, "```julia") && endswith(s, "```")),
                                       split(md, "\n\n"))

    code_without_fences = map(block -> replace(replace(block, "```julia" => ""), "```" => ""), julia_blocks)

    return join(code_without_fences, "\n\n")
end
```

This function takes a markdown document `md` as input. It filters out all the code blocks that are specifically Julia code (identified by the "```julia" fence). 

It then removes the code fences from each block and joins all the resulting code snippets together with double newlines (`\n\n`) in between each block.

The function returns a single String containing all the extracted Julia code.
